tower_tr_01.name: Training Ground #7
tower_tr_01.desc: This training program is designed for Operators and command personnel participating in the Stationary Security Service, familiarizing them with the nature of the mission, and the differences from standard combat missions.
tower_tr_01.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF

tower_tr_02.name: Training Ground #9
tower_tr_02.desc: This training program is designed for Operators and command personnel participating in the Stationary Security Service, familiarizing them with the nature of the mission, and the differences from standard combat missions.
tower_tr_02.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF

tower_tr_03.name: Training Ground #10
tower_tr_03.desc: This training program is designed for Operators and command personnel participating in the Stationary Security Service, familiarizing them with the nature of the mission, and the differences from standard combat missions.
tower_tr_03.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF

tower_n_05.name: Under-Construction Dossoles Plate
tower_n_05.desc: One of Dossoles' under-construction plates was hijacked by a gang of barrens thugs while in transit. It is said that the leader of the gang wants to convert it into an underworld boxing arena. Ms. Candela has tasked you with first teaching the gang a lesson, then inviting their leader to Dossoles for a little chat. She trusts that her sincerity will reach the other party.
tower_n_05.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF
tower_n_05.hardModeDesc:
<color=#EB2829>Emergency Resupply Conditions:</color>
All enemies take reduced damage while not being blocked;
Starting Danger Level is increased

tower_n_06.name: Acahuallan Jungle
tower_n_06.desc: Recently, the flora of the Acahuallan Jungle has thrived a bit too well, to the point where it is troubling the locals. Apparently, everything can be traced back to a dangerous creature that is half-plant, half-Originium slug. Inam tasked Gavial with eliminating this creature, and she, ever busy with her medical work, subcontracted the job to Rhodes Island without a second thought.
tower_n_06.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and Movement Speed
tower_n_06.hardModeDesc:
<color=#EB2829>Emergency Resupply Conditions:</color>
When defeated, enemies deal 50% of their ATK as Physical damage to nearby friendly units;
Starting Danger Level is increased

tower_n_07.name: Mama John's New Plate
tower_n_07.desc:
A former Mama John's employee has showed up at a new plate built by Mama for employee housing, tricking the workers into building weapons for her and sabotaging her former company's facilities. Mama John's has hired Rhodes Island to deal with the problem.
<@lv.item>No melee/ranged deployment restrictions in this operation</>
tower_n_07.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF
tower_n_07.hardModeDesc:
<color=#EB2829>Emergency supply condition:</color>
All enemies gain greatly increased ATK when they appear. ATK is reset after the first attack.
Starting danger level increased.

tower_n_08.name: Raythean Industries Test Platform
tower_n_08.desc:
An industrial gas leak at a Raythean weapons testing platform has caused many workers to become ill. The platform was occupied by bandits while being moved into the barrens for cleanup, and Raythean has tasked Rhodes Island to retake it. They wouldn't complain if you stopped the gas leaks too, while you were at it.
<@lv.item><Poison Haze> </>Your units continuously lose HP, and Poison Haze damage increases with danger level.
tower_n_08.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF
tower_n_08.hardModeDesc:
<color=#EB2829>Emergency supply condition:</color>
Poison Haze deals more damage.
Starting danger level increased.

tower_n_09.name: Alsterii Bellariorum Manufacture Platform
tower_n_09.desc: An emergency recently occurred at a dessert production platform on the outskirts of Laterano. To satisfy the increasing demand for ice cream, the technological department modified their production lines to increase capacity. However, the controllers all had to take sick leave because they ate too much ice cream, causing the automated production lines to start to spraying ice cream everywhere, and wave after wave of cargo drones to start flooding into the city to strongarm the citizens into buying more. To save ice cream's reputation, the Alsterii Monastery has requested Rhodes Island's assistance in resolving this crisis.
tower_n_09.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF
tower_n_09.hardModeDesc:
<color=#EB2829>Emergency Resupply Condition:</color>
When not blocked, the Arts and Physical damage all enemies receive decreases as the Danger Level increases.
Starting Danger Level increased.

tower_n_10.name: The Abandoned Lighthouse
tower_n_10.desc: An abandoned lighthouse situated along the Iberian coastline has attracted the attention of many explorers, yet not one to have ventured inside has ever returned. Although there are no observable abnormalities based on the lighthouse's appearance, the Inquisition suspects the area has been corroded by the abyss. They have sealed off the area and requested Rhodes Island to assist with their investigation.
tower_n_10.dangerDesc:
<color=#FF4200>Danger Level Effect:</color>
Enemies gain increased HP, ATK, and DEF
tower_n_10.hardModeDesc:
<color=#EB2829>Emergency Resupply Condition:</color>
Enemy ASPD increases according to Danger Level.
Starting Danger Level increased.

lt_tr_01.name: Training Ground #7
lt_tr_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area in a basic manner.

lt_tr_02.name: Training Ground #9
lt_tr_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area's terrain in greater detail.

lt_tr_03.name: Training Ground #10
lt_tr_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area's environment in extraordinary detail.

lt_05_01.name: The Swarming Masses
lt_05_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
For the thugs in the barrens, the important thing isn't who snatches the steak, but who gobbles it down before anyone else can do anything about it.

lt_05_02.name: Passing Down the Profit
lt_05_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
Not a single Siracusan famiglia will sit idly by while someone else monopolizes a lucrative industry. Though the times have changed, their profit-driven hearts have not.

lt_05_03.name: Industrial Improvement
lt_05_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
As the mastermind behind the theft of the under-construction plate, Sandel knows how to keep abreast of the times. However, after purchasing cutting-edge technology and the latest know-how from Kazimierz, his coffers - stretched thin to begin with - have ended up dry.

lt_05_04.name: Bad Company
lt_05_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
It is not as if Ms. Candela had not considered shadier methods before reaching out to Rhodes Island. But in the eyes of the special detachment she sent, her way of greasing palms seemed like pocket change compared to the windfall Sandel promised.

lt_05_05.name: Tipsy Trip
lt_05_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
Afterwards, thanks to Pozëmka's appeals to emotion and Gavial's appeals to reason, the Durins finally agreed to cut down on the amount they drink—at least enough to not randomly follow other people around after one round.

lt_05_06.name: A Piece of Steak
lt_05_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
The grown-up Sandel no longer has to cry in the locker room after losing a fight over some lunch money. Because he's smart enough, brave enough, and mean enough, he still has a way to go.

lt_05_01_ex.name: The Swarming Masses
lt_05_01_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
For the thugs in the barrens, the important thing isn't who snatches the steak, but who gobbles it down before anyone else can do anything about it.

lt_05_02_ex.name: Passing Down the Profit

lt_05_05_ex.name: Tipsy Trip
lt_05_05_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>6
Afterwards, thanks to Pozëmka's appeals to emotion and Gavial's appeals to reason, the Durins finally agreed to cut down on the amount they drink—at least enough to not randomly follow other people around after one round.

lt_05_06_ex.name: A Piece of Steak
lt_05_06_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
The grown-up Sandel no longer has to cry in the locker room after losing a fight over some lunch money. Because he's smart enough, brave enough, and mean enough, he still has a way to go.

lt_06_01.name: Jungle Greetings
lt_06_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
Tiacauhans are no stranger to the fistful method of saying hello, and neither are you.

lt_06_02.name: Biodiversity
lt_06_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
Confronted with a swarm of infected creatures, you notice some rarer species among them—but you don't have time to worry about that, because there are also a bunch of belligerent Tiacauhans in the mix.

lt_06_03.name: Adaptation
lt_06_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
After seeing Acahualla's overblown ecosystem for yourself, you no longer care to express your opinion on the good-for-nothings getting chummy with the infected creatures.

lt_06_04.name: Glade
lt_06_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
You find a clearing in the jungle, clear the Originium slugs from it, and plan to let the team rest up here. However, your actions seem to have gotten in the way of a group of outsiders who had a similar idea.

lt_06_05.name: Not Letting Go
lt_06_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
The outsiders' persistent attacks are getting on your nerves. You decide to crush them first, before dealing with whatever caused the rainforest to flourish out of control.

lt_06_06.name: Man And Nature
lt_06_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
You thought you'd seen everything in Acahualla, but nature's wild side always has a way of leaving you dumbfounded. Facing the extremely aggressive sea of flowers before you, all you can do is pray not to sneeze TOO much.

lt_06_01_ex.name: Jungle Greetings
lt_06_01_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
Tiacauhans are no stranger to the fistful method of saying hello, and neither are you.

You thought you'd seen everything in Acahualla, but nature's wild side always has a way of leaving you dumbfounded. Facing the extremely aggressive sea of flowers before you, all you can do is pray not to sneeze TOO much.

lt_07_01.name: I Know the Risks
lt_07_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
Disgruntled former employees have made numerous holes in the plate, and one must be careful not to fall into them. Still, there will always be those who try to profit in the midst of the chaos.

lt_07_02.name: Barrenlands Business
lt_07_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
The denizens of the barrens often make use of Infected creatures, striking the fear of Oripathy into their enemy's hearts.

lt_07_03.name: Numb Way Forward
lt_07_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
What is truly frightening is not the hidden danger, but the numbness. Those who keep their heads bowed will inevitably lose their way on the winding path.

lt_07_04.name: Chaotic Party
lt_07_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
The onlooking drunkards decided they wanted in on the action, riding their boats into the fray. Perhaps you should ask Lady Candela to be more mindful about enforcing good behavior next time.

lt_07_05.name: Messenger
lt_07_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>4
The enemy arrived as soon as you found a good place to make a stand. Are there creatures amongst the attacking mutants able to share information with one another?

lt_07_06.name: Show of Power
lt_07_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
Free from her former employer's restrictions, Mama's 'Rebel Girl' is setting up all sorts of dangerous traps and weapons. Does Mama feel regret at losing such a talent, or sad at the bedlam that she is causing?

lt_07_01_ex.name: I Know the Risks
lt_07_01_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
Disgruntled former employees have made numerous holes in the plate, and one must be careful not to fall into them. Still, there will always be those who try to profit in the midst of the chaos.

lt_07_05_ex.name: Messenger
lt_07_05_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>6
The enemy arrived as soon as you found a good place to make a stand. Are there creatures amongst the attacking mutants able to share information with one another?

lt_07_06_ex.name: Show of Power
lt_07_06_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
Free from her former employer's restrictions, Mama's 'Rebel Girl' is setting up all sorts of dangerous traps and weapons. Does Mama feel regret at losing such a talent, or sad at the bedlam that she is causing?

lt_08_01.name: Fatal Attraction
lt_08_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
The noxious industrial gas has attracted infected creatures. They will not leave until the bandit releasing the gas is stopped.

lt_08_02.name: Drunk Hammer
lt_08_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
The only thing more annoying than a drunkard is a drunkard with a heavy hammer, especially when the noxious gas has made them even more impaired.

lt_08_03.name: For Survival
lt_08_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
Mercenaries sometimes accept contracts for weapons testing, and these ones have mistaken you for the bandits occupying the platform.

lt_08_04.name: Mixed Gas
lt_08_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
Sarkaz withering mixes with the poison gas to create a suffocating combination. Take care of things quickly before you run out of time.

lt_08_05.name: Nurturing Wither
lt_08_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
Strange plants, if they can even be called that, are slowly stretching their branches out in the shadows. The gas does not seem to affect them; in fact, they seem to be nurturing something...

lt_08_06.name: Suffocation
lt_08_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
There is no length to which these wasteland bandits will not go, even releasing poison gas to capture a platform. The colorful protective suit seems to be declaring his victory.

lt_08_01_ex.name: Fatal Attraction
lt_08_01_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
The noxious industrial gas has attracted infected creatures. They will not leave until the bandit releasing the gas is stopped.

lt_08_02_ex.name: Drunk Hammer
lt_08_02_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3

lt_08_04_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
Sarkaz withering mixes with the poison gas to create a suffocating combination. Take care of things quickly before you run out of time.

lt_08_05_ex.name: Nurturing Wither
lt_08_05_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>6
Strange plants, if they can even be called that, are slowly stretching their branches out in the shadows. The gas does not seem to affect them; in fact, they seem to be nurturing something...

lt_08_06_ex.name: Suffocation
lt_08_06_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
There is no length to which these wasteland bandits will not go, even releasing poison gas to capture a platform. The colorful protective suit seems to be declaring his victory.

lt_09_01.name: Iced Shells
lt_09_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
You never knew that the sweet, delectable icing of your favorite desserts could be this hard until these rioters stood before you with their iced shields.

lt_09_02.name: Sweet Party
lt_09_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
You accidentally stumble upon the sweets thieves gorging themselves on their loot. Before you can decide whether to say hello or leave quietly, they have already spotted you, leaving you with no choice but to join in.

lt_09_03.name: Cheesy Lockdown
lt_09_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
To stop the surging waves of invaders from damaging the interior of the platform, you must stand your ground here and put a stop to their onslaught. The hard cheese is going to help... probably.

lt_09_04.name: Advanced Artisanship
lt_09_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
The advanced production lines that the technological department keeps boasting about were already covered in ice cream by the time you got here. Before you can even save the usable parts, the next wave of chaos has already arrived.

lt_09_05.name: Cream Overflow
lt_09_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
You breathe a sigh of relief when you see the Originium slugs not moving at all, but when you identify their specific species and discover the cans of cream all around them, you understand that an intense defensive battle is about to unfold.

lt_09_06.name: Smile Guaranteed
lt_09_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
Nobody can refuse such sweet smiles, especially not when they're charging toward you at full speed. But to get your hands on the limited edition waffle ice cream that the client promised, you know what you have to do.

lt_09_01_ex.name: Iced Shells
lt_09_01_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
You never knew that the sweet, delectable icing of your favorite desserts could be this hard until these rioters stood before you with their iced shields.

lt_09_05_ex.name: Cream Overflow

lt_09_06_ex.name: Smile Guaranteed
lt_09_06_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>7
Nobody can refuse such sweet smiles, especially not when they're charging toward you at full speed. But to get your hands on the limited edition waffle ice cream that the client promised, you know what you have to do.

lt_10_01.name: Sea Waves
lt_10_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>0
You swing open the door, and the ice cold sea breeze immediately surges into your lungs along with a hard-to-bear stench. Although it is somewhat different from how you remember it, you are familiar with this smell.

lt_10_02.name: Walking Dead
lt_10_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>1
The explorers who disappeared are all here. Their eyes are lifeless, and they start walking toward you unsteadily. You can feel no signs of life from them whatsoever, and your mind wavers at the sight.

lt_10_03.name: Banishment
lt_10_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
A group of colorfully-dressed explorers pours in from the pried-open door, with no idea of the dangers awaiting them. You must get them out of here, by force if necessary.

lt_10_04.name: Mirage
lt_10_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>3
Under the intense mental stimulation, you feel as though you are standing in another land entirely. You must break free of this illusion. This is your only escape.

lt_10_05.name: Fierce Currents
lt_10_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>4
Even back in reality, you have no time for rest. The horrifying scene is now conspicuous before your eyes. You are but one step from the truth, provided you can overcome the obstacle before you.

lt_10_06.name: Receding Tides
lt_10_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>5
Its shell is as cold as the sea, and its lumens as hollow as the deep abyss. Its humanborn destiny ended when it stepped into the sea, long ago. It no longer belongs here, and it must not be allowed to remain.

lt_10_01_ex.name: Sea Waves
lt_10_01_ex.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level: </>2
You swing open the door, and the ice cold sea breeze immediately surges into your lungs along with a hard-to-bear stench. Although it is somewhat different from how you remember it, you are familiar with this smell.

tatical_pioneer_01.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+20%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+1</> SP every 3 seconds

tatical_pioneer_02.desc: Convert all Tactical Equipment to Transfer Permits (<@ba.vup>10</> per equipment)

tatical_warrior_02.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+20%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+20</> ASPD

tatical_tank_01.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+40%</> DEF and <@ba.vup>+1</> Block

tatical_tank_02.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+25%</> DEF and <@ba.vup>+25%</> Max HP

tatical_sniper_02.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+25%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+25%</> Max HP

tatical_caster_01.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+20%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+1</> SP every 3 seconds

tatical_support_02.desc: After deployment, view <@ba.vup>4</> random Operators in the Preparation Area, and choose <@ba.vup>1</> of them to transfer

tatical_medic_01.desc: All allies take <@ba.vup>10%</> less Physical and Arts damage

tatical_medic_02.desc: After deployment, <@ba.vup>revive</> a <@ba.vup>downed Operator</> within range

tatical_special_01.desc: After deployment, return retreated Operators to the <@ba.vup>Deployment Waiting Zone</>, and redeployment time <@ba.vup>-50%</>

tatical_special_02.desc: Grants the relieving operator <@ba.vup>+20</> ASPD and <@ba.vup>+1</> SP every 3 seconds

card_01.name: Ægirian Oscilloscope
card_01.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive effect: </color>Abyssal Hunter Tactical Equipment limit +3 (max 5 pieces of the same type of Tactical Equipment), HP +40%, ATK +20%, DEF +20%

<color=#FF4200>Active effect: </color>View 4 random units from the Preparation Area and choose 0-2 to remove, giving all Abyssal Hunter Operators on the battlefield their classes' Tactical Equipment. If there are no Abyssal Hunter Operators on the battlefield, randomly dispatch an Abyssal Hunter Operator from the Preparation Area instead.

runeData.description: Abyssal Hunter Tactical Equipment limit +5, HP +40%, ATK +20%, DEF+20%

card_02.name: Adaptive Supply Component
card_02.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive effect: </color>All Operators have +15 starting SP; always appears in the deployment waiting zone at the start of battle.

<color=#FF4200>Active effect: </color>Places an [Adaptive Supply Component], providing Transfer Permits equal to the number of operation squad members when its skill is activated.

runeData.description: All Operators start with +15 SP

card_03.name: Energy Perturbation Amplifier
card_03.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive effect: </color>The DEF and RES of enemies affected by Slow, Bind, Stun, Cold, Frozen, or Levitate are gradually reduced, up to a maximum of -50%.

<color=#FF4200>Active effect: </color>Place an [Energy Perturbation Amplifier], periodically applying one of the following negative status effects to all enemies within range (Slow, Bind, Cold, Frozen, Stun, Levitate) for 2.5s.

runeData.description: The DEF and RES of enemies affected by Slow, Bind, Stun, Cold, Frozen, or Levitate are gradually reduced, up to a maximum of 50%.

card_04.name: Competition Records Analyzer
card_04.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive Effect:</color> When a Kazimierz Operator gains Tactical Equipment from another Kazimierz Operator, the retreating Operator returns directly to the redeployment zone.

<color=#FF4200>Active Effect:</color> Deployment Cost for Kazimierz Operators in the redeployment zone is reduced by 5.

runeData.description: When Kazimierz Operators receive Tactical Equipment from another Kazimierz Operator, the retreating Kazimierz Operator immediately returns to the Redeployment Area.

card_tower_05.name: Coating Device Conduction Valve
card_tower_05.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive effect: </color>Defender and Guard Operators gain HP +50%, DEF +30%; blocked enemies lose 5% ATK and DEF every 5s, up to 50%

<color=#FF4200>Active effect: </color>Places a [Coating Device Conduction Valve] that grants the Operator in front a barrier equal to 100% max HP (can be charged 2 times) and +2 Block.

runeData.description: Defender and Guard Operators gain HP +50%, DEF +30%; blocked enemies lose 5% ATK and DEF every 5s, up to 50%

card_tower_06.name: Eunectes' Beacon
card_tower_06.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive effect: </color>Whenever an allied high ground unit deals damage to a unit, they gain 5% ATK for 1s. Stacks up to 10 times; duration is refreshed whenever it is stacked again.

<color=#FF4200>Active effect: </color>Place a [Eunectes' Beacon]. Draws attacks from allies. When attacked by your Operators, restores 1 SP to them and increases target ASPD.

runeData.description: Whenever an allied high ground unit deals damage to a unit, it gains 5% ATK for 1s. Stacks up to 10 times.

card_tower_07.name: Tactical Equipment Toolbox
card_tower_07.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive effect: </color>For each Tactical Equipment of a distinct class that an Operator has, they gain +10% ATK and +0.1 SP recovery rate per second (stacks).

<color=#FF4200>Active effect: </color>Place a [Tactical Equipment Toolbox], giving each Tactical Equipment on Operators in front +1 temporary stack (not affected by Tactical Equipment stack limit) for 15s.

runeData.description: For each Tactical Equipment of a distinct class that an Operator has, they gain +10% ATK and +0.1 SP recovery rate per second (stacks).

card_tower_08.name: Portable First-aid Kit
card_tower_08.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive effect: </color>Excess healing on Operators is converted to a barrier that lasts 3s (absorbs physical and Arts damage, stacks); Medics heal allied Operators within range for 50% of ATK every 7s.

<color=#FF4200>Active effect: </color>View 4 random units from the Preparation Area and choose 0-2 to move to the Deployment Waiting Zone, and give all Medic Operators on the battlefield the Tactical Equipment of their classes.

runeData.description: Excess healing on Operators is converted to a barrier that lasts 3s (absorbs physical and Arts damage, stacks); Medics heal allied Operators within range for 50% of own ATK every 7s.

card_tower_09.name: Energy Overflow Converter
card_tower_09.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive Effect:</color> Operators on low ground gain 12% ATK and 12 ASPD for every Block being used.

<color=#FF4200>Active Effect:</color> Gain Transfer Permits equal to 4x the total Block of all Operators on low ground.

runeData.description: All ground Operators gain increased ATK and ASPD when blocking enemies equal to 12% per Block slot used.

card_tower_10.name: Field Support Drone
card_tower_10.desc:
<color=#FF4200>Passive Effect:</color> Operators on high ground gain +8 ASPD for every allied Operator within range.

<color=#FF4200>Active Effect:</color> Place a [Field Support Drone] which periodically loses 8% max HP and restores the HP and Elemental Damage of all allies within range equal to 1.5x the amount of HP lost. [Field Support Drone] can be healed by your Operators and does not retreat due to HP lost.

runeData.description: All Operators on ranged tiles gain +8 ASPD for every friendly Operator within their Attack Range.

subcard_01_01.name: Assault Circuit Chip
subcard_01_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive effect upgraded: </color>Abyssal Hunter Tactical Equipment limit +5 (max 5 pieces of the same type of Tactical Equipment), gain an extra piece when Abyssal Hunter Operators obtain Tactical Equipment.

runeData.description: Abyssal Hunter Tactical Equipment limit +5, HP +40%, ATK +20%, DEF+20%

subcard_01_02.name: Ambush Circuit Chip
subcard_01_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive effect upgraded: </color>[Ægirian Oscilloscope] remains on the field for 20 seconds, causing all enemies blocked by Abyssal Hunters to become stunned.

runeData.description: Abyssal Hunter Tactical Equipment limit +5, HP +40%, ATK +20%, DEF+20%

subcard_02_01.name: Weapon Supply System
subcard_02_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive effect upgraded: </color>All Caster and Sniper Operators gain +100% ATK for 15 seconds after deployment.

runeData.description: All Caster and Sniper Operators gain +100% ASPD for 15 seconds after deployment

subcard_02_02.name: Orientation Deployment Support System
subcard_02_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive effect upgraded: </color>Defender and Specialist Operators have no cost. Performs a Transfer when an Operator calls for help. (Max 3 times per battle)

runeData.description: Defender and Specialist Operators have no cost

subcard_03_01.name: Signal Blocker
subcard_03_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Upgrade: </color>Enemies affected by Slow, Bind, or Levitate take 30% more damage.

runeData.description: Enemies affected by Slow, Bind, or Levitate take 30% more damage.

subcard_03_02.name: Heteromorphic Accelerator
subcard_03_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Upgrade: </color>Duration of single-instance Stun, Cold, and Frozen effects on enemies increased by 100%.

runeData.description: Duration of single-instance Stun, Cold, and Frozen effects on enemies increased by 100%.

subcard_04_01.name: Deep Computing Unit
subcard_04_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Effect Upgrade:</color> All Operators gain 30% ATK and 50 ASPD for 10s whenever a Kazimierz Operator is deployed. Can stack if another Kazimierz Operator is deployed before effect expires.

runeData.description: All Operators gain 30% ATK and 50 ASPD for 10s whenever a Kazimierz Operator is deployed. Can stack if another Kazimierz Operator is deployed before effect expires.

subcard_04_02.name: Data Sharing Unit
subcard_04_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Effect Upgrade:</color> Kazimierz Operators gain 60% ATK and 60% DEF after 60s on the battlefield. This effect transfers to other Kazimierz Operators who receive their Tactical Equipment.

runeData.description: Kazimierz Operators gain 60% ATK and 60% DEF after 60s on the battlefield. This effect transfers to other Kazimierz Operators who receive their Tactical Equipment.

subtowercard_05_01.name: Redeployment Conduction Component
subtowercard_05_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>[Redeployment Conduction Component]</color>When in the Deployment Waiting Zone, reduces the DP of other Operators and EC Units by -3. When deployed, immediately recharges [Coating Device Conduction Valve] by 1, and performs a Transfer.

runeData.description: Defender and Guard Operators gain HP +50%, DEF +30%; blocked enemies lose 5% ATK and DEF every 5s, up to 50%

subtowercard_05_02.name: Counter Conduction Component
subtowercard_05_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive effect upgrade:</color>Blocked enemies lose 8% ATK and DEF every 5s, up to 80%. [Coating Device Conduction Valve] SP cost reduced and no longer increases block count.

runeData.description: Defender and Guard Operators gain HP +50%, DEF +30%; blocked enemies lose 8% ATK and DEF every 5s, up to 80%

subtowercard_06_01.name: Block Wavelength
subtowercard_06_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>[Block Wavelength]: </color>Enemies around [Eunectes' Beacon] are slowed for 30%; gain 15 Transfer Permits when deployed, slows enemies around [Forest Tracer Beacon] for 10s.

runeData.description: Whenever an allied high ground unit deals damage to a unit, it gains 5% ATK for 1s. Stacks up to 10 times.

subtowercard_06_02.name: Jam Wavelength
subtowercard_06_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>[Jam Wavelength]:</color>Unblocked enemies take 20% more damage; immediately perform a Transfer when deployed, enemies around [Eunectes' Beacon] gain 100% Fragile for 10s

runeData.description: Unblocked enemies take 20% more damage

subtowercard_07_01.name: Equipment Expansion Box
subtowercard_07_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Upgrade: </color>For each Tactical Equipment of a distinct class that an Operator has, they gain +15% ATK and +0.12 SP recovery rate per second (stacks).

runeData.description: For each Tactical Equipment of a distinct class that an Operator has, they gain +15% ATK and +0.12 SP recovery rate per second (stacks).

subtowercard_07_02.name: Equipment Collection Box
subtowercard_07_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Upgrade: </color>Operators that have 3 or more types of Tactical Equipment generate 5 DP and 1 Transfer Permit every 10 seconds.

runeData.description: Operators that have 3 or more types of Tactical Equipment generate 5 DP and 1 Transfer Permit every 10 seconds.
Operators recover 1 SP when healed.

subtowercard_08_02.name: Stimulation Shot
subtowercard_08_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Upgrade: </color>Operators gain +50% ATK for 3s when healed (additional heals increase duration but effect not stacks).

runeData.description: Operators gain +50% ATK for 3s when healed (additional heals increase duration but not effect).

subtowercard_09_01.name: Overclock Transformation Module
subtowercard_09_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>[Energy Overflow Converter]</color> Gain 3 Transfer Permits from each deployment slot occupied by a low ground Operator.

runeData.description: Active Effect Upgrade

subtowercard_09_02.name: Energy Recovery Module
subtowercard_09_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Effect Upgrade:</color> Low ground Operators gain SP every 5s, increasing with the amount of Block used, up to a maximum of 5.

runeData.description: All ground Operators restore an additional 1 SP per 5 seconds; This value will increase by 1 SP for every Block slot used, up to a maximum of 5 SP per 5 seconds.

subtowercard_10_01.name: Targeted Repair Formulation
subtowercard_10_01.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Effect Upgrade:</color> Operators recover 2 SP whenever they recover Elemental Damage.

runeData.description: All Operators restore 2 SP whenever they receive Elemental Damage recovery.

subtowercard_10_02.name: Receptor Stimulation Formulation
subtowercard_10_02.desc: <color=#FF4200>Passive Effect Upgrade:</color> High ground Operators gain 8% ATK for every allied Operator within range.

runeData.description: All Operators on ranged tiles additionally gain +8% ATK for every friendly Operator within their Attack Range.

cursecard_01.name: Heavy Insulated Concrete
cursecard_01.desc: Other units have +2 Cost when this is in the deployment waiting zone; cannot retreat after deployment.

cursecard_02.name: Shoddy Flashbang
cursecard_02.desc: When dispatched, causes all your high ground units to be stunned for 8s.

detailConst.firstClearTaskDesc: Clear up to Phase {0} in a single attempt
detailConst.subCardObtainDesc: Directional EC Unit selection will take place before battle on stage 4
detailConst.subGodCardUnlockDesc: <color=#828282>Select an item on the Conductive Unit screen to view details</color>

tower_season1_1.description: Use [Ægirian Oscilloscope] in any Security Operation, and reach at least stage 5

tower_season1_2.description: Use [Ægirian Oscilloscope] to complete any Security Operation, and possess 2 or more Abyssal Hunter Operators

tower_season1_3.description: Use [Adaptive Supply Component] in any Security Operation, and reach at least stage 5

tower_season1_4.description: Use [Adaptive Supply Component] to complete any Security Service, and possess 12 or more Defender or Specialist Operators

tower_season1_5.description: Use [Coating Device Conduction Valve] to complete Under-Construction Dossoles Plate

tower_season1_6.description: Use [Eunectes' Beacon] to complete Acahuallan Jungle

tower_season1_7.description: Recruit a Caster Operator 15 time(s) in Temporary Reinforcement

tower_season1_8.description: Recruit a Guard Operator 15 time(s) in Temporary Reinforcement

tower_season2_1.description: Use [Ægirian Oscilloscope] in any Security Operation, and reach stage 5 or above

tower_season2_2.description: Use [Ægirian Oscilloscope] to complete any Security Operation, and possess 2 or more Abyssal Hunter Operators

tower_season2_3.description: Use [Energy Perturbation Amplifier] in any Security Operation, and reach stage 5 or above

tower_season2_4.description: Use [Energy Perturbation Amplifier] to complete any Security Operation, and possess 10 or more Caster or Supporter Operators

tower_season2_5.description: Use [Tactical Equipment Toolbox] to complete Mama John's New Plate

tower_season2_6.description: Use [Portable First-aid Kit] to complete Raythean Industries Test Platform

tower_season2_7.description: Recruit a Defender Operator 15 time(s) in Temporary Reinforcement

tower_season2_8.description: Recruit a Sniper Operator 15 time(s) in Temporary Reinforcement

tower_season3_1.description: Use [Energy Perturbation Amplifier] in any Security Operation, and reach stage 5 or above

tower_season3_2.description: Use [Energy Perturbation Amplifier] to complete any Security Operation, and possess 10 or more Caster or Supporter Operators

tower_season3_3.description: Use [Competition Records Analyzer] in any Security Operation, and reach stage 5 or above

tower_season3_4.description: Use [Competition Records Analyzer] to complete any Security Operation, and possess 4 or more Kazimierz Operators

tower_season3_5.description: Use [Energy Overflow Converter] and clear Alsterii Bellariorum Manufacture Platform

tower_season3_6.description: Use [Field Support Drone] and clear The Abandoned Lighthouse

tower_season3_7.description: Recruit a Medic Operator 15 times in Temporary Reinforcement

tower_season3_8.description: Recruit a Vanguard Operator 15 times in Temporary Reinforcement
